newsitem.title: BULGARIA: EU cuts duty, raises imports of Bulgaria farm goods.
newsitem.headline: EU cuts duty, raises imports of Bulgaria farm goods.

text.p: Bulgaria was allowed to increase by five percent its fresh farm product exports to the European Union (EU) and to European Free Trade Assosiation (EFTA) member countries, the government press office said.
"Bulgaria's quotas for export of fresh agricultural products to the EU and EFTA member countries will be increased by five percent as of July 1," a government spokeswoman said.
Bulgaria had agreed on a further five percent annual increase in its quotas until year 2000 in a bid to boost trade turnover with EU and EFTA member countries, the government said.
Under the agreement with the EU and EFTA, customs duties levied on imported Bulgarian farm products were to be cut by twenty percent this year.
Under a funding agreement with the International Monetary Fund, Bulgaria was due to lift export restrictions for agricultural products and liberalise their prices. -- Sofia Newsroom, 359-2-981-4145
